post_text: Thanks to Representative Kay Christofferson for engaging with Alpine School District #alpineschools students! #ASDeveryONE
shared_text:
Representative Kay Christofferson
February 27, 2019 at 6:06 PM ·

American Fork High School AP Government Students of Tamara McMurray are here at the Capitol today. I was impressed by all their questions and talked to them about how becoming experts in their own fields, reading the paper, and being involved in the community can help them be informed citizens. I also shared with them what it was like to run for office. They asked about the distracted driver bill and I spoke on the responsibility that Utah citizens have to drive safely without distractions. We talked about Utah’s tax reform with lowering the overall rate by including taxable services. It is good to know that our district’s schools receive good instruction, and that these bright young people are interested in our legislative process. I hope you enjoy the rest of your visit here on the hill. Thank You!
#americanforkhighschool #APgovernment

Dear Students, Staff and Patrons,

We want you to know that we are monitoring the weather closely this evening. Our District Operations Department will have spotters out early in the morning to determine if roads and schools will be ready for buses and patrons.

Any decision for a delayed start or closing of schools occurs in the early morning hours when district snow plows are out clearing school parking lots. If a closure or delayed start occurs, the District will announce it on social media and our website (alpineschools.org). The announcement will be posted at approximately 6:00 am.

As weather conditions may differ between neighborhoods, we honor a parent’s decision to have your child arrive late or stay home.
